ref: 1699 uṇḍuka m. ʻ net, chignon, part of the body ʼ Suśr. [Cf. uṇḍēraka -- m. ʻ ball of flour, loaf, roll ʼ, uṇḍērakasraj<-> f. ʻ balls of meal on a string ʼ Yājñ.: belongs to iṇḍvà<-> and the group of words collected under vīṭā -- and is prob. ← Drav. cf. Tam. uṇṭai ʻ ball ʼ Mal. uṇḍa, Kan. Tu. uṇḍe]
Pk. uṁḍa -- , ˚aya -- m. ʻ lump, lump of flesh in the body (e.g. the heart) ʼ, uṁḍī -- f. ʻ anything round ʼ, uṁḍala -- n. ʻ raised seat ʼ;
S. ūnu m. ʻ ring used as a head -- pad ʼ,
poṭh. unnū m. ʻ hoop -- shaped mat under a head -- burden ʼ,
poṭh. unnū m. ʻ hoop -- shaped mat under a head -- burden ʼ,
awāṇ. unnū̃ ʻ pad under a pitcher ʼ;
Ku. uno ʻ pad of rags or grass to plaster with ʼ;
G. ũḍhaṇ n., ũḍhnī f. ʻ headpad made of a circle of cloth ʼ;
M. ũḍā m. ʻ lump of kneaded dough ʼ, ũḍī f. ʻ little mass of boiled rice ʼ; --
Si. uṇḍiya ʻ ball ʼ, uṇḍē ʻ cannon -- ball ʼ ←
